meanings.definition: A person or thing that winces.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was a wincer whenever she saw a spider.
meanings.sent2: The cat, a wincer at heart, always avoided loud noises.
meanings.sent3: The wincer of the group, the puppy would shy away from unfamiliar faces.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the villain was portrayed as a wincer, unable to face the consequences of his actions.
meanings.sent5: The wincer, a delicate flower, wilted at the slightest hint of criticism.

meanings.definition: To draw back or tense the body, as from pain or from a blow; start; flinch.
meanings.sent1: She would wincer every time the dentist's drill whirred to life.
meanings.sent2: The boxer couldn't help but wincer as his opponent's punch landed.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke made the audience wincer in mock horror.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the trees seemed to wincer in anticipation of the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The icy water made him wincer as he slowly dipped his toes in.
